trans-unit.source: Represents a cell in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table"></xref> control.
In this topic:
[Introduction](#introduction)
[Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax)
Introduction
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> class represents a cell in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property to specify or determine the contents of the cell.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> class allows you to control how the contents of the cell are displayed.

The alignment of the contents in the cell are specified by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.HorizontalAlign%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.VerticalAlign%2A> properties.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Wrap%2A> property to specify whether the contents of the cell wrap in the cell.
You can also specify how many rows or columns in the table, represented by a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control, are occupied by an individual cell.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.RowSpan%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.ColumnSpan%2A> properties control how many rows and columns are used, respectively.
This control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script.
Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application.
ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input.
Validation server controls are also provided to assess user input.

For more information, see [Securing Standard Controls](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f3e7718f-63d0-44a3-bd5f-48cc2059c2a8), [How to: Protect Against Script Exploits in a Web Application by Applying HTML Encoding to Strings](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/6f67973f-dda0-45a1-ba9d-e88532d7dc5b), and [Validating User Input in ASP.NET Web Pages](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4ad3dacb-89e0-4cee-89ac-40a3f2a85461).
Declarative Syntax
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> is created using the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag.Td> tag.
Adds properties specific to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell"></xref> control to the list of attributes to render.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.AddAttributesToRender%2A> method overrides the base class's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.AddAttributesToRender%2A> method and first calls the base method and then adds the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> attributes corresponding to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.RowSpan%2A> property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.ColumnSpan%2A> property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.AssociatedHeaderCellID%2A> property.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.AssociatedHeaderCellID%2A> property refers to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell> that can not be found, an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> is thrown.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.AddAttributesToRender%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> control.
The output stream that renders HTML content to the client.
A cell listed as an associated header cell was not found.
Adds a parsed child control to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell"></xref> control.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> control contains child controls then the base class's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.AddParsedSubObject%2A> method is called; otherwise, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property value is added as a <xref:System.Web.UI.LiteralControl> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> control's <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.AddParsedSubObject%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> control.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the parsed element
Gets or sets a space-separated list of table header cells associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.AssociatedHeaderCellID%2A> property contains a list of header cell programmatic identifiers that provide header information of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> control.
The list of header cell identifiers is rendered as a comma delimited list into the HTML `<td>` element's `header` attribute.
When setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.AssociatedHeaderCellID%2A> property use a comma delimited list of strings.

If an element of the list is not recognized as a valid table header cell an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> is thrown when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.AddAttributesToRender%2A> is invoked.
An array of strings containing the identifiers of the associated table header cells.
Gets or sets the number of columns in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table"></xref> control that the cell spans.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.ColumnSpan%2A> property to specify or determine the number of columns in the rendered table that the cell spans.
For example, if you set this property to `2`, the cell takes up two columns in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control.
The number of columns in the rendered table that the cell spans.
The default value is `0`, which indicates that this property is not set.
The selected value is less than `0`.
Creates a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle> created by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.CreateControlStyle%2A> method is used with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Wrap%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.HorizontalAlign%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.VerticalAlign%2A> properties.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.CreateControlStyle%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> control.

A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that represents the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell"></xref> control.
Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the contents in the cell.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.HorizontalAlign%2A> property to specify the horizontal alignment of the contents of the cell.
The possible values for use are specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign> enumeration.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign"></xref> enumeration values.
The default is `NotSet`.
Renders the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell"></xref> contents to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> control has child controls or is overridden in a derived class the base class's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.RenderContents%2A> method is called; otherwise, the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property is written to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.RenderContents%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> control.
The output stream that renders HTML content to the client.
Gets or sets the number of rows in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table"></xref> control that the cell spans.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.RowSpan%2A> property to specify or determine the number of rows in the rendered table that the cell spans.
For example, if you set this property to `2`, the cell takes up two rows in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control.
The number of rows in the rendered table that the cell spans.
The default value is `0`, which indicates that this property is not set.
The selected value is less than `0`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the control should set the `disabled` attribute of the rendered HTML element to "disabled" when the control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.IsEnabled"></xref> property is `false`.
This property indicates how ASP.NET should render HTML for a control when the control is disabled.
If this property is `true`, ASP.NET renders a `disabled` attribute when a control is disabled.
If this property is `false`, ASP.NET renders a `class` attribute when a control is disabled.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.SupportsDisabledAttribute%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
`true` if the property indicates an ASP.NET version lower than 4.0; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the text contents of the cell.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property to specify or determine the text contents of the cell.
This property is commonly used to programmatically update the contents of a cell.
Setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property will clear any other controls contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script.
Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application.
ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input.
Validation server controls are also provided to assess user input.

For more information, see [Securing Standard Controls](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f3e7718f-63d0-44a3-bd5f-48cc2059c2a8), [How to: Protect Against Script Exploits in a Web Application by Applying HTML Encoding to Strings](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/6f67973f-dda0-45a1-ba9d-e88532d7dc5b), and [Validating User Input in ASP.NET Web Pages](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4ad3dacb-89e0-4cee-89ac-40a3f2a85461).
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
The text contents of the cell.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the contents in the cell.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.VerticalAlign%2A> property to specify the vertical alignment of the contents of the cell.
The possible values for use are specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.VerticalAlign> enumeration.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.VerticalAlign"></xref> enumeration values.
The default is `NotSet`.
Gets or sets a value that indicating whether the contents of the cell wrap.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Wrap%2A> property to specify or determine whether the content of the cell wrap in the cell.
`true` if the contents of the cell wrap in the cell; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
